title: Calories in Sauerkraut
meta_description: Discover calories in sauerkraut per 100 g, including carbs, fiber, protein, fat, sodium details, and preparation tweaks for better nutrition tracking.
assumptions: Drained, canned or jarred sauerkraut; fermented cabbage with salt; no added sugars or vinegar.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, fermentation process, added ingredients, and draining method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 100 g of sauerkraut contains about 19 kcal and is low in calories but high in sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: With 1 tsp olive oil added (per 100 g)

faqs.q: How many calories in sauerkraut per serving?

faqs.a: Yes, 4.3 g carbs per 100 g, with 2.9 g fiber.

faqs.q: Why is sodium high in sauerkraut?
faqs.a: Fermentation process uses salt; 661 mg per 100 g. Rinse to lower it.
Minimal change if heated briefly; prolonged cooking may reduce some nutrients but not calories significantly.

faqs.q: What are the benefits beyond calories in sauerkraut?
faqs.a: Probiotics for gut health, vitamin C, and fiber; low fat and protein at 0.9 g per 100 g.
